results.title: Infernal Affairs
results.creator_credit: Felix Chong, Alan Mak, Andrew Lau and Media Asia Films
results.brief_description: Chan Wing Yan, a young police officer, has been sent undercover as a mole in the local mafia. Lau Kin Ming, a young mafia member, infiltrates the police force. Years later, their older counterparts, Chen Wing Yan and Inspector Lau Kin Ming, respectively, race against time to expose the mole within their midst.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

constellations_other.name: Wong Kar-Wai's Hollywood fingerprints
constellations_other.description: Wong Kar-wai’s modern masterpiece In The Mood For Love is a rich, romantic melodrama that follows the entangled lives of two neighbours (Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung) who develop feelings for each other after learning their spouses are having an affair.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Felix Chong, Alan Mak, Andrew Lau and Media Asia Films

Years later, their older counterparts, Chen Wing Yan and Inspector Lau Kin Ming, respectively, race against time to expose the mole within their midst.

results.title: Independence Day
results.brief_description: On July 2, a giant alien mothership enters orbit around Earth and deploys several dozen saucer-shaped ‘destroyer’ spacecraft that quickly lay waste to major cities around the planet.

constellations_other.name: Hack the planet
constellations_other.description: How do you represent something that's... kinda boring to look at, like hacking, when you're operating in a visual medium like film, TV and videogames?

results.description: On July 2, a giant alien mothership enters orbit around Earth and deploys several dozen saucer-shaped ‘destroyer’ spacecraft that quickly lay waste to major cities around the planet. On July 3, the United States conducts a coordinated counterattack that fails. On July 4, a plan is devised to gain access to the interior of the alien mothership in space, in order to plant a nuclear missile.

On July 3, the United States conducts a coordinated counterattack that fails. On July 4, a plan is devised to gain access to the interior of the alien mothership in space, in order to plant a nuclear missile.

results.title: Inception
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2010
results.brief_description: Cobb, a skilled thief who commits corporate espionage by infiltrating the subconscious of his targets, is offered a chance to regain his old life as payment for a task considered to be impossible: “inception”, the implantation of another person’s idea into a target’s subconscious.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2010

results.title: In the Wake of the Bounty
results.brief_description: The film explores the story of the Bounty and is based on the 1932 novel Mutiny on the Bounty by Charles Nordhoff and James Norman Hall.
results.description: The film explores the story of the Bounty and is based on the 1932 novel Mutiny on the Bounty by Charles Nordhoff and James Norman Hall.

results.title: In the Mood for Love
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Block 2 Pictures, Jet Tone Production, Wong Kar-wai and William Chang
results.brief_description: In 1962 Hong Kong, Chow (Tony Leung) and Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) are neighbours. Their respective spouses are having an affair and the two lonely souls find themselves increasingly attracted to each other, but resist repeating the betrayals of their partners.

constellations_primary.name: Wong Kar-Wai's Hollywood fingerprints
constellations_primary.description: Wong Kar-wai’s modern masterpiece In The Mood For Love is a rich, romantic melodrama that follows the entangled lives of two neighbours (Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung) who develop feelings for each other after learning their spouses are having an affair.

constellations_other.name: Into a World of Colour
constellations_other.description: Filmmakers have been using colour as a method of storytelling since the first moving pictures. Colour can be used to signify emotion, intensify drama or to create a strong visual aesthetic.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, Block 2 Pictures, Jet Tone Production, Wong Kar-wai and William Chang
results.description: In 1962 Hong Kong, Chow (Tony Leung) and Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) are neighbours. Their respective spouses are having an affair and the two lonely souls find themselves increasingly attracted to each other. But the morality of the times, and their own conflicted emotions, will not allow them to repeat the betrayals of their partners. On its release, “In the mood for love” singularly revitalised romanticism in film. An exquisite recreation of the Hong Kong of the early sixties is achieved through Kar-Wai concentrating on the colors and textures of cloth and surfaces; on the sound of rain and the rustle of bodies passing each other in narrow hallways. The film can be compared to a lyrical chamber piece where the direction of Kar-Wai, the luscious cinematography of Christopher Doyle, the musical score by Michael Galasso, the intimate performances of Cheung and Leung, and the stunning production design of William Chang Suk-Ping come together to form an astonishing powerful cinematic quintet. A love story that can justifiably be called timeless and mise-en-scene so romantic that it carries enormous emotion gravitas, this film has won awards throughout the globe (including Best Actor for Leung at Cannes as well as an outstanding technical achievement award for the combined talents of the filmmakers).
description_for_label: In 1962 Hong Kong, Chow (Tony Leung) and Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) are neighbours. Their respective spouses are having an affair and the two lonely souls find themselves increasingly attracted to each other. But the morality of the times, and their own conflicted emotions, will not allow them to repeat the betrayals of their partners. On its release, “In the mood for love” singularly revitalised romanticism in film. results.title: In the Labyrinth
results.brief_description: A multi-image large-format film retelling of the Greek myth of Theseus and symbolizing the life of a modern man; each one in a personal labyrinth that must find their own path to triumph.

constellations_other.name: Big screen dreams
constellations_other.description: With groundbreaking technology and a unique cinema experience, today IMAX theatres are not only loved by audiences but championed by pioneering filmmakers like Christopher Nolan and James Cameron. Yet the route to get there was an unconventional one.

results.description: A multi-image large-format film retelling of the Greek myth of Theseus and symbolizing the life of a modern man; each one in a personal labyrinth that must find their own path to triumph.

results.title: In Name Only
results.brief_description: A wealthy man falls for a widow but is locked into a loveless marriage with a woman who has contrived to convince his parents she is the ideal wife.
results.description: A wealthy man falls for a widow but is locked into a loveless marriage with a woman who has contrived to convince his parents she is the ideal wife.

results.title: In Melbourne Tonight
results.brief_description: In Melbourne Tonight, also known as “IMT”, was a highly popular nightly variety television show produced at GTV-9 Melbourne from 6 May 1957 to 1970.

constellations_other.name: 1950s television
constellations_other.description: "Good evening ... and welcome to television." Bruce Gyngell’s famous words launched television in Australia in 1956 on Sydney’s TCN9, with the medium finally arriving in the country towards the later end of the decade.

results.description: In Melbourne Tonight, also known as “IMT”, was a highly popular nightly variety television show produced at GTV-9 Melbourne from 6 May 1957 to 1970.

images.caption: Image via IMDB.com
images.alt_text: A picture of Graham kennedy, an older white man holding a microphone

results.title: Icarus
results.creator_credit: Diamond Docs, Rise Films, Impact Partners, Alex Productions, Lagralane Group, The, Mark Monroe, Dan Cogan, Jim Swartz, Bryan Fogel, Jon Bertain, David Fialkow and Timothy Rode
results.brief_description: While investigating the furtive world of illegal doping in sports, director Bryan Fogel connects with renegade Russian scientist Dr. Grigory Rodchenkov—a pillar of his country’s “anti-doping” program. Over dozens of Skype calls, urine samples, and badly administered hormone injections, Fogel and Rodchenkov grow closer despite shocking allegations that place Rodchenkov at the center of Russia’s state-sponsored Olympic doping program.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Diamond Docs, Rise Films, Impact Partners, Alex Productions, Lagralane Group, The, Mark Monroe, Dan Cogan, Jim Swartz, Bryan Fogel, Jon Bertain, David Fialkow and Timothy Rode

results.title: I, Tonya
results.creator_credit: LuckyChap Entertainment, Clubhouse Pictures, Jade Healy, Margot Robbie, Jennifer Johnson, Bryan Unkeless, Tom Ackerley, Steven Rogers, Craig Gillespie, Justin David Burton and Pierina Bustamante
results.brief_description: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U. S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the sport is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.
